intro: Oxytropis ocrensis, commonly known as the purple sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, violet-blue flowers. The plant has compound leaves with oval-shaped leaflets and produces pods that contain several seeds. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland deserts. Oxytropis ocrensis is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitats.
